meanings.definition: To show or guide someone to a place.
meanings.sent1: The kind librarian ushered the children to the story corner.
meanings.sent2: The tour guide ushered the visitors to the historical monument.
meanings.sent3: The friendly dog ushered the lost kitten back to its cozy bed.
meanings.sent4: The sunflower ushered the bees to its golden petals with a sweet fragrance.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse ushered the ships safely to the harbor in the stormy night.

meanings.definition: To introduce or announce someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The host ushered the guest of honor to the stage for the speech.
meanings.sent2: The principal ushered the new students into the school assembly.
meanings.sent3: The magician ushered the rabbit out of the hat to the audience's surprise.
meanings.sent4: The morning birds ushered the arrival of a new day with their cheerful songs.
meanings.sent5: The town crier ushered the important news to the villagers in the square.

meanings.definition: To lead or bring something into a place or situation.
meanings.sent1: The chef ushered the aromatic dish out of the kitchen to the dining area.
meanings.sent2: The conductor ushered the orchestra onto the grand stage for the performance.
meanings.sent3: The wind ushered the colorful leaves into a swirling dance in the autumn air.
meanings.sent4: The river ushered the canoe gently downstream with its steady flow.
meanings.sent5: The teacher ushered the students' creativity into the art project with encouraging words.
